product.title: PHPKD - Language Tool Kit 'Lite'
product.description: This product adds extensible multilingual features for international and global forums, these incredible multilingual tools provide you with translation, transliteration and virtual keyboard abilities using Google's powerful language APIs as backend.
product.author: $Author: PHPKD $

phrasetype.name: Posting
phrasetype.phrase: Type a word in English and press SPACE to transliterate. Press {1} for toggling (activate/deactivate) the transliterate mode.

phrasetype.name: vBulletin Settings
phrasetype.phrase: Choose whether the product "PHPKD - Language Tool Kit 'Lite'" is active or not (Global On/Off Switch).

You do not need a key to use this product & it's backend APIs. Using a key in is completely optional. However, it is useful to have one. Here is why - when a key is present, if Google detects any problem or issue that involves your application/site, with a key in hand, they will attempt to contact you. If Google does not have a key, they have no way to contact you should something go wrong.
If you are ready, go ahead and sign up for an API key.

Which language tool do you wish to set as default for your forum? This choice will be applied by default on all users without customized choice -if user options enabled, otherwise it will be the forced option on all users all over the forum board-.

Where do you wish to activate this product? You've multiple valid locations this product can be applied on & take affect:
  1. New Thread
  2. New Reply
  3. New Private Message

You can specify certain forums to have this product's effect, or to exclude others from being participated at all.
You've three options to choose from:
  • Include All Forums
  • Include Specific Forums
  • Exclude Specific Forums
Select "Include All Forums" for the product to take effect on all forums (DEFAULT), or select "Include Specific Forums" for the product to take effect on certain forums only -defined in the following setting-, or select "Exclude Specific Forums" for the product NOT to take effect on certain forums -defined in the following setting-.

If you've chosen "Include Specific Forums" OR "Exclude Specific Forums" from the above setting, then you've to enter those specified forum IDs here in this setting's field. Please enter forum IDs separated with commas.

You can specify certain usergroups to have this product's effect, or to exclude others from being participated at all.
You've three options to choose from:
  • Include All Usergroups
  • Include Specific Usergroups
  • Exclude Specific Usergroups
Select "Include All Usergroups" for the product to take effect on all usergroups (DEFAULT), or select "Include Specific Usergroups" for the product to take effect on certain usergroups only -defined in the following setting-, or select "Exclude Specific Usergroups" for the product NOT to take effect on certain usergroups -defined in the following setting-.

If you've chosen "Include Specific Usergroups" OR "Exclude Specific Usergroups" from the above setting, then you've to enter those specified usergroup IDs here in this setting's field. Please enter usergroup IDs separated with commas.

You can specify certain users to have this product's effect, or to exclude others from being participated at all.
You've three options to choose from:
  • Include All Users
  • Include Specific Users
  • Exclude Specific Users
Select "Include All Users" for the product to take effect on all users (DEFAULT), or select "Include Specific Users" for the product to take effect on certain users only -defined in the following setting-, or select "Exclude Specific Users" for the product NOT to take effect on certain users -defined in the following setting-.

If you've chosen "Include Specific Users" OR "Exclude Specific Users" from the above setting, then you've to enter those specified user IDs here in this setting's field. Please enter user IDs separated with commas.

Where do you wish to activate this product? You've multiple valid locations this product can be applied on & take affect:
  1. Thread Quick Reply
  2. Private Message Quick Reply
  3. Profile Visitor Message
  4. Album Picture Comment
  5. Social Group Comment
  6. Social Group Picture Comment
  7. Blog Comments

You can enable this product on certain styles only & keep it disabled for others, just select the styles you wish this product to take affect on. For multiple selecting press 'CTRL' & keep holding it while selecting.

When enabled, text typed within input fields & text areas -where the translation is enabled- will be auto translated. Just hitting space or typing punctuation character after the word will make that word auto translated to the destination language. Note: There's a switch button within the editor buttons always available for users to activate or deactivate auto translation.
Which language do you wish to set as the default destination language for the translation?
You can select which languages are available for users as destination languages for translation, just check required & leave others unchecked.

Specify the shortcut key to use to toggle translation. The shortcut key is specified as a string containing modifiers such as 'ctrl', 'alt' or 'shift' along with an alphabet key. For example, 'ctrl+g', 'ctrl+shift+a' would be valid shortcut key combination. This does not allow 'shift' as the only modifier. Hence, 'shift+g' would not be a valid shortcut key combination.
Which language do you wish to set as the default source language for the translation?
You can select which languages are available for users as source languages for translation, just check required & leave others unchecked.

When enabled, text typed within input fields & text areas -where the transliteration is enabled- will be auto transliterated. Just hitting space or typing punctuation character after the word will make that word auto transliterated to the destination language. Note: There's a switch button within the editor buttons always available for users to activate or deactivate auto transliteration.
Which language do you wish to set as the default destination language for the transliteration?
You can select which languages are available for users as destination languages for transliteration, just check required & leave others unchecked.

Specify the shortcut key to use to toggle transliteration. The shortcut key is specified as a string containing modifiers such as 'ctrl', 'alt' or 'shift' along with an alphabet key. For example, 'ctrl+g', 'ctrl+shift+a' would be valid shortcut key combination. This does not allow 'shift' as the only modifier. Hence, 'shift+g' would not be a valid shortcut key combination.

Which language do you wish to set as the default source language for the transliteration?
At the mean time, English only is supported by Google's transliteration APIs as the source language.

You can select which languages are available for users as source languages for transliteration, just check required & leave others unchecked.
At the mean time, English only is supported by Google's transliteration APIs as the source language.

You can allow users to select their preferred language tool (either Translation, Transliteration or Virtual Keyboard) from their control panel options by checking which options are available for their choice. If you don't need to allow users to do so & wish to force certain language tool for all users then keep all options here unchecked and select your preferred option from the next setting "Default Language Tool". Note: two choices at least required to allow user choice options.

When enabled, virtual keyboard will be auto displayed for input fields & text areas -where virtual keyboard is enabled-. Note: There's a switch button within the editor buttons always available for users to display or hide virtual keyboard.
Which layout do you wish to set as the default layout for virtual keyboard?
Which layouts do you wish to allow for users within virtual keyboard? Just check required & leave others unchecked.
